title: Atta Tarar in Beijing for Global Civilizations Dialogue Ministerial Meeting
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 09 (APP): Federal Minister for Information and Broadcasting Attaullah Tarar arrived in Beijing on Wednesday to participate in the prestigious Global Civilizations Dialogue Ministerial Meeting.
The Ministerial Meeting is organized by the Publicity Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) and the International Department of the CPC Central Committee, Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China.
The event, taking place from July 10th to July 11th, is part of President Xi Jinping’s vision of Global Civilizations Initiative (GCI), said a news release here.
During the conference, the Minister is scheduled to deliver a key address at the sub-forum titled “Civilizational Exchanges and Mutual Learning: Cultural Inheritance and Innovation.” His participation underscores the importance of fostering dialogue and collaboration between diverse civilizations in the areas of culture, media, and innovation.
In addition to his speaking engagement, the Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with Ms. Cao Shumin, Deputy Head of the Publicity Department of the CPC Central Committee, and Minister and Party Secretary of the NRTA (National Radio and Television Administration China).
The discussions will focus on strengthening ongoing media cooperation between Pakistan and China, as well as exploring new opportunities for collaboration to further enhance mutual understanding and cultural exchange.
Attaullah Tarar’s participation at this high level event is reflection of the strong bond shared by the leadership of China and Pakistan and its people.
The Minister’s visit highlights Pakistan’s commitment to strengthening ties with China, especially in the fields of media, culture, and communication, and demonstrates both countries’ shared vision for enhancing global civilizational dialogue.
Upon his arrival in Beijing, the Minister said the dialogue among diverse civilizations is crucial for fostering global harmony, peace and development. Pakistan would continue to play proactive role in this regard, he added.
Cultural and media cooperation between Pakistan and China is playing critical role in bringing the two nations more close, the Minister remarked.
He said the Ministerial Dialogue presents us with an opportunity to promote mutual respect and a spirit of learning among civilizations around the world.
